title: Ticket #962: STARTD_CRON function disagrees with documentation: ARGS
description:
http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.4/3_3Configuration.html#18586

The documentation fails to mention that the name from the joblist is always passed as the first argument to the EXECUTABLE. 

$ _CONDOR_STARTD_CRON_JOBLIST=TEST _CONDOR_STARTD_CRON_TEST_EXECUTABLE=/bin/echo _CONDOR_STARTD_CRON_TEST_ARGS="A=1" _CONDOR_STARTD_CRON_TEST_PERIOD=5s condor_startd -t -f
...
11/17 11:43:00 Cron: STDOUT closed for 'TEST'
11/17 11:43:00 Cron: STDERR closed for 'TEST'
11/17 11:43:00 DaemonCore: No more children processes to reap.
11/17 11:43:00 Getting monitoring info for pid 12580

11/17 11:43:00 TEST: 1 lines in Queue
11/17 11:43:00 Can't insert 'TEST A=1' into 'TEST' ClassAd
remarks: Ticket merged into existing ticket #609.
creator: matt
